results.title: Greece: So rich, so poor
results.brief_description: Reviews the problems impending the development of Greece in ancient and modern times. Discusses the economy, agriculture, and education of Greece and the challenge for Greece’s future.

results.title: Greece the immortal land
results.creator_credit: Basil Wright, Gladys Wright and Realist Films
results.brief_description: An evocative documentary showing Greece as the background to western civilisation. The artistic treasures of antiquity are seen side by side with the life of the sturdy people today. Contains many spectacular shots of the Parthenon, the ruins of Mistra and Mycenae and the sunbaked landscape along with candid camera sequences of the Greeks of today. Independently financed, this film aroused lively critical comment in Great Britain.

results.title: Great wonders of the world; a Doug Jones travelogue
results.brief_description: Narrated and filmed by Doug Jones, this video takes us on a whirlwind journey around the world to see the great sights. The Pyramids, Colosseum, Big Ben and the Eiffel Tower feature as man-made wonders, while the Grand Canyon and Ayers Rock are part of the natural splendour of our planet. This video offers a taste of what the world has to offer but this is more than enough to tantalise the armchair traveller.

results.title: Great winds general principles
results.creator_credit: Margaret Simpson, Frank Wells and Gaumont-British Instructional
results.brief_description: The film deals with the theory of the circulation of the atmosphere, The distribution of pressure and wind belts in relation to the overhead noon-day sun is established on an imaginary globe, whose surface is made of one material (thus eliminating the effects of the unequal heating of land and sea). It is shown how the great wind belts shift during the year, following the apparent movement of the sun. It is demonstrated that this seasonal shift brings certain parts of the world (the Mediterranean lands) into different wind belts at opposite times of the year.

results.title: Great wildlife moments
results.creator_credit: Doug Mackay-Hope, Matthew Clements and British Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description: A compilation of great wildlife cinematography celebrating the 50 year history of the British Broadcasting Corporation’s Natural History Unit. Look on in wonder as killer whales come ashore to hunt seals, tigers fight and Sir David lounges around with a gorilla family. Separated into seven sections, this is a wonderful testament to the hard working people that make these spectacular programs. The sections are: Sea and shore ; Forests ; Freshwater ; Snow and ice ; Grasslands ; Sky ; Jungles. Some of the greatest wildlife moments compiled into one collection with an introduction by Sir David Attenborough.

results.title: Great white shark
results.creator_credit: Paul Atkins, Grace Atkins, National Geographic Society and BBC
results.brief_description: The Great White Shark has a reputation of being one of the most feared creatures on earth, this fear no doubt heightend in the past by Hollywood films such as “Jaws”. However, in this revealing expose, David Attenborough attempts to show us that there are several sides to this awe-inspiring species - killing machine maybe, selective and skilful hunter absolutely. Through some excellent underwater photography, including a remote video camera attached to a shark, we see the natural behaviour and environment of the Great White and up-close shots of not just one, but several sharks as they swim, hunt and mate. Mostly filmed around the oceans of Cape Coast at the southern most tip of South Africa, this documentary is both educational and entertaining. Photography by Paul Atkins, Peter Scoones, Doug Allen.

results.title: Great walls make great art
results.brief_description: Great art is one of the world’s most expensive commodities - well out of the reach of most people. This film considers the multimillion dollar art industry which makes available inexpensive paintings according to public tastes and changing fashions in interior design.
